definition: very serious/solemn
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing
eight/8
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
surname Bai

sentences.english: But serious if the say thing that Chuang Tzu.
sentences.chinese: 而是正經八百的再說這莊子事兒。

sentences.english: Ma has managed some serious political acrobatics.
sentences.chinese: 馬英九搞了一些正經八百的政治把戲。

sentences.english: A: Why do you look so serious?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼一副正經八百的樣子？

sentences.english: If this holiday sounds too serious, don't worry.
sentences.chinese: 如果您覺得這個節日太正經八百，別擔心。

to follow obediently

to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl

one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
